metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4095 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in Linux kernel before 5.19.2. This issueoccurs in cmd_hdl_filter in drivers/staging/rtl8712/rtl8712_cmd.c, allowingan attacker to launch a local denial of service attack and gain escalationof privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4095` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-201.212
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-201.212
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-201.212
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-201.212
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-201.212
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-201.212').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
